newsitem.title: UK: BT won't be drawn on any French NTT move.
newsitem.headline: BT won't be drawn on any French NTT move.

text.p: British Telecommunications (BT) declined to be drawn on Thursday on a newspaper report that Japan's Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp had approached investment banks to evaluate a deal in France. In an unsourced article, The Financial Times said that NTT, with which BT has been openly seeking an international alliance, was exploring a 300 million stg investment alongside BT in France's new telecoms operator Cegetel.
But a BT spokesman said only: "If NTT have appointed investment bankers that is their decision."

He declined to comment on whether BT would welcome a link with the Japanese titan, with which all three major international telecoms alliances are desperately trying to link up in order to gain access to the lucrative Asian markets.
BT is investing 1.1 billion stg for a 25 percent stake in Cegetel, which was set up by Cie Generale des Eaux and is seen as the main rival to France Telecom.
BT's chief executive Sir Peter Bonfield is travelling to Japan at the end of this month for a business conference at which he is likely to meet NTT executives.
